title: 108_s864
content: The "National Guard and Reserves Child Care Relief Act" authorizes appropriations of $10,000,000 for fiscal years 2004 through 2008 to provide child care for certain military dependents. SEC. 3. CHILD CARE ASSISTANCE FOR MILITARY DEPENDENTS. The Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990 is amended to include child care assistance for military dependents. The Secretary will provide grants to help eligible persons pay for child care services for dependents by eligible providers. A dependent is defined as an individual meeting specific criteria. The term 'eligible person' refers to a parent of dependents of Armed Forces members on active duty for more than 30 days in support of a military operation. The term 'eligible person' is a parent of dependents of Armed Forces members on active duty involved in a military operation, responsible for their care, and living at least 50 miles from a military installation with child care facilities. The term 'eligible person' refers to a parent of dependents of Armed Forces members on active duty involved in a military operation, responsible for their care, and living at least 50 miles from a military installation with child care facilities. Facilities and programs are available for use by dependents of the member, including the nearest child development center or family child care home funded by the Department of Defense. Military operations include Operation Enduring Freedom, Operation Iraqi Freedom, Operation Noble Eagle. To be eligible for a grant under this section, a person must submit an application to the Secretary with information about the child care provider. The provisions of this subchapter apply to Operation Noble Eagle and successor operations of the United States Armed Forces. The provisions of section 658P do not apply to assistance provided under this section. Section 658O of the Child Care and Development Block Grant Act of 1990 is amended to change the appropriations under different sections.
